source: 如果他离职，没有人能抵他的工作。
correct reference: If he leaves, no one can take over his job.
incorrect reference: If he leaves, no one can arrive in his job.
base translation: If he resigns, no one can replace his work.

reason: The word 抵 (dǐ) in the Chinese text implies that the persons work is of such high quality that it cannot be easily replaced or replicated. The phrase fill his position in the first translation candidate implies that someone else can simply step in and do the same job, which may not be the case if the persons work is truly irreplaceable. The word match in the second translation candidate acknowledges the unique nature of the persons work and the difficulty in finding someone else who can do it just as well. Therefore, the correct translation is: If he resigns, no one can match his work.
